page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area of our survey covers the three original villages of Roydon, Eastwick and Little Parndon. In 1947 Harlow Development Corporation was set up and by 1960 Little Parndon village had disappeared into the new town of Harlow and had given its name to the Little Parndon neighbourhood. When we first drove round our area we noticed that it was mainly countryside under farming and we saw two grain crops being grown - wheat and barley - and vegetable crops included potatoes, peas and broad beans. There are many trees in our area both in country and town. Harlow was always a well wooded area thanks to the work put in by farmers in the 19th century and to Sir Frederick Gibberd who planned Harlow and preserved as many
